>So said Michael Orozco on 2003-07-11 --------------------
>I am probably =
doing this all wrong! But If I only want to run certain
>tests. I put a let=
ter in front of the test that I don't want to run, and
>it is ignored at ru=
ntime. I do this because junit usually runs the methods
>that have the word=
 test in front of it, and ignores the others.
>
>If there is a better, or p=
roper way to do this please let me know.

Yes. Identify the tests that you =
tend to run as a group, then put them in a smaller suite.

Either that or b=
uild your own TestCollector that creates a suite of the methods you want. I=
t would be relatively easy to build the accompanying GUI to make it simpler=
 to pick tests.

Look at GSBase's RecursiveTestSuite, which allows you to f=
ilter tests based on any criterion you can ask the Test object.

Take care.=
